Finding: Controller uses template fields (name/description/type/isDeleted) that don't exist on Agent Prisma model
Suggested Change: Replace template field references with actual Agent model fields: userId role commissionRate status isActive hiredAt territoryId supervisorId

Finding: prisma.bet does not exist on PrismaClient — 8 references fail
Suggested Change: Check Prisma schema model name (likely 'Bet' or different casing). Verify bet.prisma declares the model correctly and run prisma generate

Finding: prisma.commission does not exist on PrismaClient — 5+ references fail
Suggested Change: Check Prisma schema model name in commission.prisma. Verify model declaration and run prisma generate

Finding: All controllers are copy-paste from template.controller.ts without adaptation to their actual Prisma model fields
Suggested Change: Each controller must be regenerated or manually updated: create/update input types audit log field refs and softDelete filter must match the actual Prisma model

Finding: Zod validation schemas likely also contain template-default fields (name/description/type) that don't match actual models
Suggested Change: Audit each zod/<module>.zod.ts and update CreateSchema/UpdateSchema to match Prisma model fields

Finding: Lint script references non-existent lib-entry.ts causing ESLint to abort entirely
Suggested Change: Remove lib-entry.ts from lint script or create the file

Finding: Soft-delete pattern uses isDeleted field but most Prisma models don't have this field
Suggested Change: Either add isDeleted to all models that need it or remove the soft-delete filter from controllers that don't support it

Finding: All 17 controllers follow identical structure (good) but audit log references template.name when the model may not have a name field
Suggested Change: Make audit log descriptions use a field that actually exists on each model (e.g. id as fallback)

Finding: Module imports use lowercase (drawschedule juetengdraw) but folder names use camelCase (drawSchedule juetengDraw)
Suggested Change: Align import variable names with folder naming convention for consistency
